intro: Humboltia arachnantha, commonly known as the spider plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces fibrous, spiny capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care. Humboltia arachnantha thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial shade to full sun.
